subject: Re: [junit] Counting junit test failures/errors
msgSnippet: ... It can be... TestNG lets you do this: @Test(invocationCount = 1000, successPercentageCount = 90) public void foo() { } ... which will invoke this method
messageBody:
On 8/25/06, Kevin Lawrence <kev.lawrence@...> wrote:
>
>
> Setting a threshold that is not zero seems artificial and not very
> useful to me.
>

It can be...

TestNG lets you do this:

@Test(invocationCount = 1000, successPercentageCount = 90)
public void foo() { }

... which will invoke this method 1000 times and will only report a failure
if more than 100 fail.

This feature was requested by users who do tests that are allowed to fail
for a certain threshold, such as sending packets on an unreliable network.

--
Cédric


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
